{{Use dmy dates|date=October 2017}} {{Infobox football biography |name = Ola Aina |image = Ola Aina 2016.jpg |image_size = 200 |caption = |fullname = Temitayo Olufisayo Olaoluwa Aina{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=2 February 2018 |accessdate=10 February 2018}} |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1996|10|8|df=y}}{{cite web |title=Ola Aina |url=http://www.11v11.com/players/ola-aina-250021/|work=11v11.com |publisher=AFS Enterprises|accessdate=16 January 2016}} |birth_place = [[London Borough of Southwark|Southwark]], [[London]], England |height = 1.75 m |position = [[Defender (association_football)#Wing-back|Wing-back]] |currentclub = [[Torino F.C.|Torino]]
(on loan from [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]]) |clubnumber = 34 |youthyears1 = 2007–2015 |youthclubs1 = [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] |years1 = 2015– |clubs1 = [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] |caps1 = 3 |goals1 = 0 |years2 = 2017–2018 |clubs2 = → [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] (loan) |caps2 = 44 |goals2 = 0 |years3 = 2018– |clubs3 = → [[Torino F.C.|Torino]] (loan) |caps3 = 20 |goals3 = 1 |nationalyears1 = 2011–2012 |nationalteam1 = [[England national under-16 football team|England U16]] |nationalcaps1 = 6 |nationalgoals1 = 0 |nationalyears2 = 2012–2013 |nationalteam2 = [[England national under-17 football team|England U17]] |nationalcaps2 = 11 |nationalgoals2 = 0 |nationalyears3 = 2013 |nationalteam3 = [[England national under-18 football team|England U18]] |nationalcaps3 = 1 |nationalgoals3 = 0 |nationalyears4 = 2013–2015 |nationalteam4 = [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]] |nationalcaps4 = 13 |nationalgoals4 = 0 |nationalyears5 = 2015–2016 |nationalteam5 = [[England national under-20 football team|England U20]] |nationalcaps5 = 6 |nationalgoals5 = 0 |nationalyears6 = 2017– |nationalteam6 = [[Nigeria national football team|Nigeria]] |nationalcaps6 = 8 |nationalgoals6 = 0 |club-update = 16:08, 10 February 2019 (UTC) |ntupdate = 17:05, 17 November 2018 (UTC) }} '''Temitayo Olufisayo Olaoluwa "Ola" Aina''' (born 8 October 1996) is a professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association_football)#Wing-back|wing-back]] for Italian club [[Torino F.C.|Torino]], on loan from English club [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], and the [[Nigeria national football team|Nigeria national team]]. ==Club career== ===Chelsea=== ====Early career==== Ola Aina signed for Chelsea as an under-11 and made his youth team debut as a schoolboy in the 2012–13 season and went on to start in both legs of the semi-final and final of the FA Youth Cup. In his youth career, he has also represented Chelsea in the under-18s, under-19s, and under-21 levels.{{cite web|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/teams/first-team/ola-aina.html |title=Ola Aina Chelsea Profile |accessdate=23 August 2016 |publisher=Chelsea F.C.}} On 19 July 2014, Aina made his first-team debut in a pre-season friendly against [[AFC Wimbledon]], after [[Todd Kane]]'s injury. Aina started the match and was [[Substitute (association football)|substituted]] at half-time for [[Branislav Ivanović]] as Chelsea went on to win 3–2.{{cite web|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2014/07/afc-wimbledon-v-chelsea.html |title=Match report: AFC Wimbledon 2 Chelsea 3 |date=19 July 2014 |publisher=Chelsea F.C.|accessdate=26 August 2016}} Before the 2015–16 season, he was included in the pre-season tour, playing three matches in the [[2015 International Champions Cup|International Champions Cup]]. After impressing Chelsea manager [[José Mourinho]], Aina was included in the first-team squad for the [[2015–16 Chelsea F.C. season|campaign]]. Although he spent the entire season training full-time with the first-team, he continued his role in the under-21s and under-19s sides. On 23 September 2015, Aina was included in the match-day squad against [[Walsall F.C.|Walsall]] in the fourth round of the [[2015–16 Football League Cup|League Cup]], although he was an unused substitute.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/34265632 |title=Walsall 1–4 Chelsea |date=23 September 2015|publisher=BBC Sports|accessdate=26 August 2016}} Due to a lack of first-team opportunities, Aina refused a new contract despite his current contact ending at the end of the season.{{cite web|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/arsenal-join-transfer-race-sign-7161465 |title=Arsenal join transfer race to sign Chelsea's England Under-21 right-back Ola Aina |date=11 January 2016|accessdate=26 August 2016}} ====2016–17 season==== On 6 July 2016, he signed a new four-year contract, ending the rumours of him leaving the London side.{{cite web|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2016/07/aina-seals-new-deal.html |title=Aina seals new deal |date=6 July 2016 |publisher=Chelsea F.C.|accessdate=26 August 2016}} After signing a new contract, Aina was included in the travelling squad to Austria and the United States. He went on to play in all six pre-season matches. On 23 August 2016, Aina was given his professional debut by manager [[Antonio Conte]] in a 3–2 victory over [[Bristol Rovers F.C.|Bristol Rovers]] in the [[2016–17 EFL Cup|EFL Cup]], being replaced by [[John Terry]] in the 77th minute.{{Cite news |title=Chelsea 3–2 Bristol Rovers |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37091061 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=23 August 2016 |accessdate=23 August 2016}} On 15 October 2016, he made his [[Premier League]] debut in a 3–0 victory over reigning champions [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]], replacing goalscorer [[Victor Moses]] in the 82nd minute.{{Cite news |title=Chelsea 3–0 Leicester City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37594219 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=15 October 2016 |accessdate=15 October 2016}} ====Loan to Hull City==== On 11 July 2017, Chelsea announced that they had loaned Aina to [[EFL Championship|Championship]] side [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]].{{Cite news |title=First loan for Aina |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2017/07/aina-out-on-loan.html |publisher=Chelsea Official Site |date=11 July 2017 |accessdate=11 July 2017}} He made his debut on the opening day of the season, 5 August 2017, away to [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]], in a 1–1 draw.{{cite news | url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40760772 | title = Aston Villa 1–1 Hull City | date = 5 August 2017 | work = BBC Sport | publisher = BBC | accessdate = 5 August 2017}} He scored the only goal in a 1–0 defeat of [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]] in the third-round of the [[FA Cup]] on 6 January 2018.{{cite news | url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42519393 | title = Blackburn Rovers 0–1 Hull City | date = 6 January 2018 | work = BBC Sport | publisher = BBC | accessdate = 6 January 2018}} ====Loan to Torino==== On 14 August 2018, Aina joined Italian club [[Torino F.C.|Torino]] on a season-long loan after signing a new three-year deal with Chelsea.{{Cite news |title=New contract and loan for Aina |url=https://www.chelseafc.com/en/news/2018/8/14/new-contract-and-loan-for-aina |publisher=Chelsea Official Site |date=14 August 2018 |accessdate=14 August 2018}} He made his [[Serie A]] debut a few days later in Torino's 0–1 opening day defeat at home to [[A.S. Roma|Roma]], coming on as a substitute in place of fellow right-back [[Lorenzo De Silvestri]] who went off injured after just 25 minutes.{{cite web|url=http://www.legaseriea.it/en/serie-a/match-report/2018-19/UNICO/UNI/1/TORROM|title=Fixtures and Results - Season 2018-19 - 1^ Match Day - Lega Serie A|website=www.legaseriea.it|accessdate=19 August 2018}} ==International career== ===England youth teams=== Aina has represented England at [[England national under-16 football team|under-16]], [[England national under-17 football team|under-17]], [[England national under-18 football team|under-18]], [[England national under-19 football team|under-19]] and [[England national under-20 football team|England under-20]] levels. ===Nigeria=== [[File:Ola Aina-Nigeria.jpg|thumb|right|Aina with Nigeria against Argentina, Uzomedia]] On 28 March 2017, Aina was pictured alongside [[Chuba Akpom]] of [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] after discussions with [[Nigeria Football Federation]] president, [[Amaju Pinnick]].{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en-ng/news/4110/nigerians-abroad/2017/03/28/34076632/chelseas-ola-aina-brighton-and-hove-albions-chuba-akpom|title=Chelsea's Ola Aina, Brighton and Hove Albion's Chuba Akpom pledge allegiance to Nigeria|author=Oludare, Shina|date=28 March 2017|publisher=Goal Nigeria|accessdate=28 March 2017}} In May 2017, Aina pledged his international future to Nigeria and obtained a Nigerian passport in preparation to making the switch from England to Nigeria.{{cite web|url=http://dailypost.ng/2017/05/12/nff-confirms-ola-aina-joel-bazee-now-nigerian-passports-tammy-abraham-follow/|title=NFF confirms Ola Aina, Joel Bazee now have Nigerian passports, Tammy Abraham to follow|date=12 May 2017|publisher=|accessdate=15 May 2017}}{{cite web|url=http://www.vanguardngr.com/2017/05/nff-formally-applies-ainas-intl-switch/|title=NFF formally applies for Aina's int'l switch – Vanguard News|date=4 May 2017|publisher=|accessdate=15 May 2017}}{{cite web|url=https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/3481081/chelsea-ola-aina-nigeria-england/|title=Chelsea's London-born starlet Ola Aina poised to snub England and play for Nigeria|date=4 May 2017|publisher=|accessdate=15 May 2017}} In the same month, he was called up for the first time to play for Nigeria.{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/nigeria/story/3122106/chelseas-ola-aina-gets-nigeria-call|title=Chelsea's Ola Aina gets Nigeria call|publisher=|accessdate=17 May 2017}} In May 2018 he was named in Nigeria’s preliminary 30 man [[Nigeria national football team| squad]] for the [[2018 World Cup]] in [[Russia]].{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/amp/news/revealed-every-world-cup-2018-squad-23-man-preliminary-lists/oa0atsduflsv1nsf6oqk576rb|title=Revealed: Every World Cup 2018 squad - 23-man & preliminary lists & when will they be announced? |website= Goal.com|publisher=|accessdate=17 May 2018}} However, he did not make the final 23.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44346451|title=World Cup 2018: Arsenal's Iwobi in Nigeria's 23-man squad|date=3 June 2018|publisher=|accessdate=20 August 2018|work=BBC Sport}} ==Club statistics== {{updated|match played 10 February 2019.}}{{Soccerway|temitayo-aina/274798|accessdate=8 January 2017}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |+ Appearances and goals by club,
